subject: Photography
title: Kodak: You Press the Button
description: A quick win: understand Kodak: You Press the Button.

hook.text: In 1888, George Eastman launched a camera with a slogan: 'You press the button, we do the rest.'

buildup.text: The Kodak camera came preloaded with 100 exposures. When done, you mailed the whole camera back for processing.

discovery.text: For the first time, you didn't need chemistry skills or a darkroom. Anyone could take a photograph.

twist.text: Kodak didn't just sell cameras. It sold the idea that everyday moments â€” birthdays, vacations â€” were worth capturing.

climax.text: Eastman democratized photography. Within a generation, cameras were in millions of homes.

punchline.text: He didn't invent the camera. He made it for everyone.

quiz.question: What made the original Kodak camera revolutionary?
options: It made photography accessible to anyone, no skills needed
It was the first digital camera
